abstract.p: Butterfly Webb letter on Web site questionnaire about race relations in America describes discrimination she feels at staffing firm where most of her colleagues are Jewishï¿½

block.p: About three months ago, I joined a staffing firm as a recruiter. My immediate superior as well as the majority of my colleagues are Jewish. It didn't take long until my boss and co-workers started making ''jokes'' about my race, calling me ''colored'' and ordering me to go sit in the back of the bus (referring to the back of the office, where I sat). I was devastated that they thought they weren't being racist just because they were Jewish. I complained to one of the executive partners of the company, but they did nothing to change the caustic environment or to protect me from retaliation.

I'm afraid that people really have given up on being sensitive about cultural issues. Everybody wants to ''tolerate'' one another, which really means: ''Let's not fight, O.K.? Let's just ignore one another as much as possible, work together in a very hierarchical relationship and talk about everything but racism.'' Teaching tolerance is a bunch of baloney.
